metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4715 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Yann Collet LZ4 before r119, when used on certain 32-bit platforms thatallocate memory beyond 0x80000000, does not properly detect integeroverflows, which allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial ofservice (memory corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact via acrafted Literal Run, a different vulnerability than CVE-2014-4611.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4715` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 42.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 42.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 42.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 42.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:38.3.0+build1-0ubuntu2
